content.question: A local department store estimates that 10 percent of its customers return the merchandise they purchase. Let the random variable <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the number of returns for a random sample of 40 customers. Assume that random variable <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> follows a binomial distribution. What is described by the value of <math alttext="40 choose 8 times 0.1 to the eighth power, times 0.9 to the 32 power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtable><mtr><mtd><mn>40</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>8</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable><mo>)</mo></mrow><msup><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.9</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>32</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The mean of the random variable
The variance of the random variable
The standard deviation of the random variable
The probability that 8 customers in the sample will return merchandise
The probability of selecting a sample of 40 customers who will all return merchandise

content.answer: The probability that 8 customers in the sample will return merchandise
